intro: Zucchellia angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan zucchini, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces yellow flowers and edible, cylindrical fruits that resemble zucchini. Its leaves are broad and lobed, typical of many members of its family. Zucchellia angolensis is often cultivated for its nutritional value and versatility in cooking.
